label: 弁官
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: Divided into the Controlling Board of the Left (Sabenkan) and the Right (Ubenkan). Each was in charge of supervising the work of four ministries (shō). The officials of these Boards were known as Controllers (Ben). Boards were a division of the Great Council of State (Dajōkan). [左弁官、右弁官、省、弁、太政官]
